docs.lead_paragraph: With sign-up season launching this weekend, officials sharply dialed down expectations Monday for the second year of President Barack Obama's health insurance law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Politics, not legal reasoning, is behind the assault on Obamacare that is now headed to the Supreme Court.

headline.seo: The Latest Frivolous Attack on Obamacare

docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column decries Supreme Court's decision to hear case that seeks to overturn the Affordable Care Act on the basis of a small error in law's language; argues that suit, which hinges on an aspect of the law that was not intended by those who drafted it, should have been laughed out of court long ago; holds that politics, rather than legal reasoning, is behind the Supreme Court's decision to hear it.
docs.snippet: Politics, not legal reasoning, is behind the assault on Obamacare that is now headed to the Supreme Court.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The union that represents theater performers plans to drop insurance for about 200 members, leaving a Harlem man to wonder how he will manage the higher costs of a new plan.

headline.main: A Veteran Actor’s Backstage Fight for Affordable Health Care
headline.print_headline: A Veteran Actor’s Backstage Fight for Affordable Health Care

docs.abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column discusses anxieties over how the health fund for Actors’ Equity, union that represents theater performers, is about to drop scores of struggling actors from its health insurance plan; focuses on veteran actor Richard E Waits, who has trouble at times with his vision, his hips and his neck, has other chronic conditions and has struggled to stay afloat financially.
docs.snippet: The union that represents theater performers plans to drop insurance for about 200 members, leaving a Harlem man to wonder how he will manage the higher costs of a new plan.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said that people would be able to compare their options beginning Monday and that the site was now easier to use.

headline.main: New HealthCare.gov Opens Early to Allow for Review of Plans
headline.print_headline: New HealthCare.gov Opens Early to Allow for Review of Plans

docs.abstract: Obama administration announces that consumers can shop for health insurance and compare their options on HealthCare.gov five days before open enrollment period formally begins; Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services official says new website has more information and is easier to use than one that frustrated consumers in fall of 2013.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said that people would be able to compare their options beginning Monday and that the site was now easier to use.

docs.lead_paragraph: Insurance underwriters involved in a legal battle with the Rolling Stones over a $12.7 million claim have won permission to seek evidence in Utah about the mental health of Mick Jagger's girlfriend before she took her life in March.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. officials planned to unveil an improved healthcare insurance website on Sunday they hope will allow the second enrollment period under President Barack Obama's health reform plan to avoid the technical meltdown that plagued its launch last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: The residents of Belle Harbor Manor spent four miserable months in emergency shelters after Superstorm Sandy's floodwaters surged through their assisted-living center on New York City's Rockaway peninsula.
